meanings.sent1: Her estimable kindness touched everyone she met.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's estimable dedication to her students was truly admirable.
meanings.sent3: His estimable talent for making people laugh brightened even the gloomiest days.
meanings.sent4: The estimable courage of the firefighters battling the blaze was truly heroic.
meanings.sent5: The estimable beauty of the sunset took our breath away.

meanings.definition: Capable of being estimated or valued.
meanings.sent1: The estimable cost of the project was within the budget.
meanings.sent2: The estimable weight of the package made it easy to carry.
meanings.sent3: It was estimable how quickly she finished the puzzle, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The estimable worth of the antique vase was revealed at the auction.
meanings.sent5: The estimable size of the tree made it a perfect climbing spot for the children.
